Package org.zaproxy.zap.view.messagecontainer

Interface MessageContainer<T extends Message>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of message in this container
All Known Subinterfaces:
HttpMessageContainer, MultipleHistoryReferencesContainer, MultipleHttpMessagesContainer, MultipleMessagesContainer<T>, SelectableContentHttpMessageContainer, SelectableContentMessageContainer<T>, SelectableHistoryReferencesContainer, SelectableHttpMessagesContainer, SelectableMessagesContainer<T>, SingleHistoryReferenceContainer, SingleHttpMessageContainer, SingleMessageContainer<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractHttpMessageContainer, AbstractMessageContainer, DefaultMultipleHistoryReferencesContainer, DefaultMultipleHttpMessagesContainer, DefaultSelectableHistoryReferencesContainer, DefaultSelectableHttpMessagesContainer, DefaultSingleHistoryReferenceContainer, DefaultSingleHttpMessageContainer, HttpRequestAllPanelSyntaxHighlightTextView, HttpRequestBodyPanelSyntaxHighlightTextView, HttpRequestHeaderPanelSyntaxHighlightTextView
public interface MessageContainer<T extends Message>
Base interface for GUI components that contain Messages, for example, JList, JTable and JTextArea.

Hides the implementation details and the GUI component used to show the messages, while providing access to those messages and to some extent its state (for example, with SelectableMessagesContainer to get the selected messages).

The containers can opt to expose only a snapshot of the container state, instead of giving access to the current (always updated) state, depending on how they are accessed. For example, when the container state is exposed to a pop up menu invocation (which is a short living action) the container might return only the selection state at that point in time, so further queries to the exposed selection state will, always, return the same values.

No assumptions should be made on the implementation types used to return the container state. For example, if the Lists are modifiable or not.

Note: No hard Reference should be kept to the messages containers longer than needed to do the actual work as it would prevent the unloading of the classes (when the corresponding add-ons are uninstalled).

Since:
2.3.0

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Component
    getComponent()
    Returns the GUI component of the message container.
    Class<T>
    getMessageClass()
    Returns the Class of the container's message, for use as runtime type token.
    String
    getName()
    Returns the name of the message container.
    boolean
    isEmpty()
    Tells whether or not the message container is empty, that is, doesn't contain any message.

  • Method Details

    • getMessageClass

      Class<T> getMessageClass()
      Returns the Class of the container's message, for use as runtime type token.
      Returns:
      the Class of the container's message.

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the name of the message container.

      The name should be unique among other containers since it will be used to uniquely identify them.

      Returns:
      the name of the container, never null.

    • getComponent

      Component getComponent()
      Returns the GUI component of the message container.

      Actual type of the component depends on the implementation, example component types: JList, JTable, JTextArea, ...

      Returns:
      the GUI component of the container, never null.

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Tells whether or not the message container is empty, that is, doesn't contain any message.
      Returns:
      true if the container is empty, false otherwise.
